14.verse: He will break it like a clay pot, ruthlessly shattering it into pieces so tiny not even a potsherd remains for taking fire from the fireplace or scooping water from the cistern.

15.verse: For this is what Adonai ELOHIM, the Holy One of Isra’el, says: “Returning and resting is what will save you; calmness and confidence will make you strong — but you want none of this!

16.verse: ‘No!’ you say, ‘We will flee on horseback!’ Therefore you will surely flee. And, ‘We will ride on swift ones!’ So your pursuers will be swift.

17.verse: A thousand will flee at the threat of one, you all will flee at the threat of five, until you are left isolated, like a flagstaff on a mountaintop, like a banner on a hill.”

18.verse: Yet ADONAI is just waiting to show you favor, he will have pity on you from on high; for ADONAI is a God of justice; happy are all who wait for him!

19.verse: People in Tziyon, who live in Yerushalayim, you will weep no more. At the sound of your cry, he will show you his grace; on hearing it, he will answer you.

20.verse: Though Adonai may give you but bread and water, and not very much of that; your teacher will no longer hide himself, but with your own eyes you will see your teacher.

21.verse: With your ears you will hear a word from behind you: “This is the way; stay on it, whether you go to the right or the left.”

22.verse: You will treat as unclean your silver-covered idols and your cast metal images plated with gold; you will throw them away, like menstrual cloths; you will say to them, “Get out of here!”

23.verse: Then he will give you rain for the seed you use to sow your land; and the food that comes from the ground will be rich and abundant. When that day comes, your cattle will graze in spacious pastures.

24.verse: The oxen and donkeys that work the land will eat a tasty mixture, winnowed free of chaff, spread by pitchfork and shovel.

25.verse: On every high mountain and lofty hill will be streams and flowing brooks, on a day of great slaughter, when the towers fall.

26.verse: Moreover, the light of the moon will be as bright as the light of the sun; and the light of the sun will be seven times stronger, like the light of seven days [in one], on the day ADONAI binds up the wounds of his people and heals the bruise caused by the blow.

27.verse: Here comes the name of ADONAI from afar, his anger burning, in thick rising smoke. His lips are full to the brim with fury, his tongue a consuming fire.

28.verse: His breath is like a racing torrent that rises up to the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction, and put a bridle in the peoples’ mouths to lead them astray.

29.verse: Your song will be like one that is sung on a night when a holy feast is kept, and your hearts will be happy, as if walking to the sound of the flute, to the mountain of ADONAI, to the Rock of Isra’el.

30.verse: ADONAI will make his glorious voice heard, and he will reveal his arm descending with furious anger in a flaming firestorm, with cloudbursts, tempests and hailstones.

31.verse: For ADONAI’s voice will terrify Ashur, as with his scepter he strikes them down.

32.verse: Every sweep of the punishing rod that ADONAI imposes on him will be to tambourines and lyres, as he brandishes his arm against them in battle.

33.verse: For the Tofet fire pit has long been ready, prepared for the king, made large and deep, with plenty of wood and blazing with fire; like a stream of sulfur, ADONAI’s breath sets it aflame.

1.verse: Woe to those going down to Egypt expecting help — relying on horses; trusting in chariots, because they have many, and in the strength of their cavalrymen — but not looking to the Holy One of Isra’el, not consulting ADONAI.

2.verse: But he too is wise and can bring disaster, and he does not take back his words; he will rise against the house of evildoers and against the help of those who do wrong.

3.verse: Now the Egyptians are men and not God, and their horses flesh and not spirit. So when ADONAI stretches out his hand, both he who helps will stumble, and he who is helped will fall; both will perish together.

4.verse: For here is what ADONAI says to me: “As a lion or lion cub growls at its prey and isn’t frightened away by the shouts of hordes of shepherds called out against him — their voices do not upset him — so likewise ADONAI-Tzva’ot will descend to fight on Mount Tziyon, on its hill.

5.verse: Like hovering birds, ADONAI-Tzva’ot will protect Yerushalayim. In protecting it, he will rescue it; in sparing it, he will save it.

6.verse: People of Isra’el! Return to him to whom you have been so deeply disloyal!

7.verse: For on that day everyone will discard his idols of silver and idols of gold, which you made for yourselves with your own sinful hands.

8.verse: Then Ashur will fall by a sword not of mortals, a sword, not of humans, will devour him; he will flee before the sword, and his young men will be put to forced labor.

9.verse: His rock, out of terror, will pass away, and his panicked officers will desert the standard.” So says ADONAI, whose fire is in Tziyon, whose furnace is in Yerushalayim.

1.verse: There is coming a king who will reign justly and princes who will rule uprightly.

2.verse: A man will be like a refuge from the wind, like protection from a storm, like streams of water on arid ground, like a rock cliff shading a weary land.

3.verse: The eyes of those seeing will not be closed, the ears of those hearing will pay close attention.

4.verse: The minds of the impetuous will learn to weigh carefully, the tongues of the stutterers will speak readily and clearly.

5.verse: The mean person will no longer be called generous, or the miserly said to be noble;

6.verse: for the mean person will speak meanness, his heart planning evil, so that he can act godlessly, spreading error concerning ADONAI, as he lets the hungry go on starving and deprives the thirsty of drink.

7.verse: The mean person’s means are mean — he devises wicked devices to ruin the poor and needy with lies, even when their cause is just.

8.verse: But the generous person devises generous things, and his generosity will keep him standing.

9.verse: You women who are so complacent, listen to me! Overconfident women, pay attention to my words!

10.verse: In a year and a few days more, you overconfident women will shudder, because the vintage will fail, the harvest will not come.

11.verse: Tremble, you complacent women! Shudder, you overconfident women! Strip bare, wear sackcloth to cover yourselves.

12.verse: Beat your breasts in mourning for the pleasant fields and fruitful vines,

13.verse: for the land of my people, producing thorns and briars, for all the happy homes in the joyful city.

14.verse: For the palace will be abandoned, the crowded city deserted, ‘Ofel and fortress wastelands forever, a delight for wild donkeys and a pasture for flocks —

15.verse: till the Spirit is poured out on us from above, and the desert becomes a fertile field, with the fertile field regarded as a forest.

16.verse: Then justice will dwell in the desert, and righteousness abide in the fertile field.

17.verse: The effect of righteousness will be peace; the result of righteousness, quiet trust forever.

18.verse: My people will live in a peaceful place, in secure neighborhoods and tranquil dwellings.

19.verse: Just as the forest will surely come down, the city will surely be laid low.

20.verse: Happy are you who sow by all streams, letting oxen and donkeys roam freely.

1.verse: Woe, destroyer, yourself undestroyed! Woe, betrayer, yourself unbetrayed! When you stop destroying, you will be destroyed; when you tire of betraying, they will betray you.

2.verse: ADONAI, show us mercy; we have waited for you. Be their arm every morning, and our salvation in time of trouble.

3.verse: At the sound of the tumult, the peoples wander off; when you exalt yourself, the nations are scattered.

4.verse: Your spoil is gathered as if stripped by shearer-worms; they run over it like a swarm of locusts.

5.verse: ADONAI is exalted, for he dwells on high; he has filled Tziyon with justice and right.

6.verse: He will be the stability of your times, a wealth of salvation, wisdom and knowledge, and fear of ADONAI, which is his treasure.

7.verse: Hear their brave men crying out for help! The envoys of peace weep bitterly.

8.verse: The highways are deserted, there are no travelers. He has broken the covenant, despised the cities; he has no regard for human life.

9.verse: The land is mourning and wilting away. The L’vanon is withering with shame. The Sharon has become like the ‘Aravah. Bashan and Karmel have been shaken bare.

10.verse: “Now I will arise,” says ADONAI, “Now I will exalt and lift myself up.

11.verse: You conceive chaff and give birth to stubble, your breath is a fire devouring you.

12.verse: The peoples will be as if burned into lime, like thorns cut off to burn in the fire.

13.verse: You living far off, hear what I have done! You who are near, acknowledge my strength!”

14.verse: The sinners in Tziyon are frightened; trembling has seized the ungodly. “Who of us can live with the devouring fire? Who of us can live with eternal burning?”

15.verse: He whose life is right and whose speech is straight, he who scorns getting rich by extortion, he who shakes his hands free of bribes, stops his ears against talk of bloodshed and shuts his eyes against looking at evil.

16.verse: Such a person will live on the heights, his refuge a fortress among the cliffs, his food and water in steady supply.

17.verse: Your eyes will see the king in his beauty, they will gaze on a land stretching into the distance.

18.verse: Your mind will meditate on the terror: “Where is the man who did the counting? Where is the man who did the weighing? Where is the man who numbered the towers?”

19.verse: You will not see the intransigent people, that people whose language is so obscure, whose stuttering speech you cannot understand.

20.verse: Look at Tziyon, the city of our festivals; your eyes will see Yerushalayim a secure abode, a tent that will not be removed, whose pegs will never be pulled out and whose guy-ropes will not be cut.

21.verse: But there in his splendor ADONAI will be with us, in a place of rivers and broad streams. But no boat with oars will go there, no majestic ship will pass by.

22.verse: For ADONAI is our judge, ADONAI is our lawgiver, ADONAI is our king. He will save us.

23.verse: For your ropes are hanging loose, not holding the mast, not spreading the sail. Then the plunder shared out is so huge that even the lame get part of the spoil.

24.verse: No inhabitant will say, “I am ill”; the people living there will be forgiven their sin.

1.verse: Come close, you nations, and listen! Pay close attention, you peoples! Let the earth hear, and everything in it; the world, with all it produces.

2.verse: For ADONAI is angry at every nation, furious with all their armies; he has completely destroyed them, handed them over to slaughter.

3.verse: Their slain will be thrown out, the stench will rise from their corpses, the mountains will flow with their blood.

4.verse: The whole host of heaven will decompose, the heavens themselves be rolled up like a scroll; all their array will wither away like a withering grape-leaf that falls from a vine or a withered fig from a fig tree.

5.verse: “For my sword has drunk its fill in heaven; now it descends on Edom to judge them, the people I have doomed to destruction.”

6.verse: There is a sword that belongs to ADONAI. It is filled with blood, gorged with fat, filled with the blood of lambs and goats, gorged with the fat of the kidneys of rams. For ADONAI has a sacrifice in Botzrah, a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

7.verse: The wild oxen will fall with them, the young bulls with the strong, mature ones. Their land will be drunk with blood and their dust made greasy with fat.

8.verse: For ADONAI has a day of vengeance, a year of requital for fighting with Tziyon.

9.verse: Its streams will be changed to tar, its dust to sulfur, its land burning tar

10.verse: that will not be quenched night or day; its smoke will rise forever. In all generations it will lie waste; no one will pass through it ever again.

11.verse: Horned owl and hawk will possess it, screech owl and raven will live there; he will stretch over it the measuring line of confusion and the plumbline of the empty void.

12.verse: Of its nobles, none will be called to be king, and all its princes will be nothing.

13.verse: Thorns will overgrow its palaces, nettles and thistles its fortresses; it will become a lair for jackals, an enclosure for ostriches.

14.verse: Wildcats and hyenas will meet there; and billy-goats call to each other; Lilit [the night monster] will lurk there and find herself a place to rest.

15.verse: There the hoot owl will nest, lay her eggs, hatch and gather her young in its shade. There the vultures will assemble, every one with its mate.

16.verse: Consult the book of ADONAI and read it: not one of these will be missing, none will be lacking a mate. For by his own mouth he gave the order, and by his Spirit he brought them together.

17.verse: It is he who cast the lot for them, his hand measured out their shares. They will possess it forever, and live there through all generations.

1.verse: The desert and the dry land will be glad; the ‘Aravah will rejoice and blossom like the lily.

2.verse: It will burst into flower, will rejoice with joy and singing, will be given the glory of the L’vanon, the splendor of Karmel and the Sharon. They will see the glory of ADONAI, the splendor of our God.

3.verse: Strengthen your drooping arms, and steady your tottering knees.

4.verse: Say to the fainthearted, “Be strong and unafraid! Here is your God; he will come with vengeance; with God’s retribution he will come and save you.”

5.verse: Then the eyes of the blind will be opened, and the ears of the deaf will be unstopped;

6.verse: then the lame man will leap like a deer, and the mute person’s tongue will sing. For in the desert, springs will burst forth, streams of water in the ‘Aravah;

7.verse: the sandy mirage will become a pool, the thirsty ground springs of water. The haunts where jackals lie down will become a marsh filled with reeds and papyrus.

8.verse: A highway will be there, a way, called the Way of Holiness. The unclean will not pass over it, but it will be for those whom he guides — fools will not stray along it.

9.verse: No lion or other beast of prey will be there, traveling on it. They will not be found there, but the redeemed will go there.

10.verse: Those ransomed by ADONAI will return and come with singing to Tziyon, on their heads will be everlasting joy. They will acquire gladness and joy, while sorrow and sighing will flee.

1.verse: It was in the fourteenth year of King Hizkiyahu that Sancheriv king of Ashur advanced against all the fortified cities of Y’hudah and captured them.

2.verse: From Lakhish the king of Ashur sent Rav-Shakeh to Hizkiyahu in Yerushalayim with a large army. He positioned himself by the aqueduct from the Upper Pool, which is by the road to the Launderers’ Field.

3.verse: Elyakim the son of Hilkiyahu, who was in charge of the household, Shevnah the general secretary and Yo’ach the son of Asaf the foreign minister went out to meet him.

4.verse: Rav-Shakeh addressed them: “Tell Hizkiyahu: ‘Here is what the great king, the king of Ashur, says: “What makes you so confident?

5.verse: I say: do mere words constitute strategy and strength for battle? In whom, then, are you trusting when you rebel against me like this?

6.verse: Look! Relying on Egypt is like using a broken stick as a staff — when you lean on it, it punctures your hand. That’s what Pharaoh king of Egypt is like for anyone who puts his trust in him.

7.verse: But if you tell me, ‘We trust in ADONAI our God,’ then isn’t he the one whose high places and altars Hizkiyahu has removed, telling Y’hudah and Yerushalayim, ‘You must worship before this altar’?

8.verse: All right, then, make a wager with my lord the king of Ashur: I will give you two thousand horses if you can find enough riders for them.

9.verse: How then can you repulse even one of my master’s lowest-ranked army officers? Yet you are relying on Egypt for chariots and riders!

10.verse: Do you think I have come up to this land to destroy it without ADONAI’s approval? ADONAI said to me, ‘Go up against this land and destroy it!’ ” ’ ”

11.verse: Elyakim, Shevnah and Yo’ach said to Rav-Shakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it; don’t speak to us in Hebrew while the people on the wall are listening.”

12.verse: But Rav-Shakeh answered, “Did my master send me to deliver my message just to your master and yourselves? Didn’t he send me to address the men sitting on the wall, who, like you, are going to eat their own dung and drink their own urine?”

13.verse: Then Rav-Shakeh stood up and, speaking loudly in Hebrew, said: “Hear what the great king, the king of Ashur, says!

14.verse: This is what the king says: ‘Don’t let Hizkiyahu deceive you, because he won’t be able to save you.

15.verse: And don’t let Hizkiyahu make you trust in ADONAI by saying, “ADONAI will surely save us; this city will not be given over to the king of Ashur.”

16.verse: Don’t listen to Hizkiyahu.’ For this is what the king says: ‘Make peace with me, surrender to me. Then every one of you can eat from his vine and fig tree and drink the water in his own cistern,

17.verse: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land with grain and wine, a land with bread and vineyards.

18.verse: Beware of Hizkiyahu; he is only deluding you when he says, “ADONAI will save us.” Has any god of any nation ever saved his land from the power of the king of Ashur?

19.verse: Where are the gods of Hamat and Arpad? Where are the gods of S’farvayim? Did they save Shomron from my power?

20.verse: Where is the god of any of these countries that has saved its country from my power, so that ADONAI might be able to save Yerushalayim from my power?’”

21.verse: But they kept still and didn’t answer him so much as a word, for the king’s order was, “Don’t answer him.”

22.verse: Then Elyakim the son of Hilkiyahu, who was in charge of the household, Shevnah the general secretary and Yo’ach the son of Asaf the foreign minister went to Hizkiyahu with their clothes torn and reported to him what Rav-Shakeh had said.

1.verse: On hearing it, King Hizkiyahu tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth and entered the house of ADONAI.

2.verse: He sent Elyakim, who was in charge of the household, Shevnah the general secretary and the leading cohanim, covered with sackcloth, to Yesha‘yahu the prophet, the son of Amotz.

3.verse: They said to him, “This is what Hizkiyahu says: ‘Today is a day of trouble, rebuke and disgrace. Children are ready to be born, but there is no strength to bring them to birth.

4.verse: Maybe ADONAI your God will hear the words of Rav-Shakeh, whom his master the king of Ashur has sent to taunt the living God, and will rebuke the message which ADONAI your God has heard. So pray for the remnant that is left.’”

5.verse: When King Hizkiyahu’s servants came to Yesha‘yahu,

6.verse: he said to them, “Tell your master that this is what ADONAI says: ‘Don’t be afraid of the words you heard the servants of the king of Ashur use to insult me.

7.verse: I will put a spirit in him that will make him hear a rumor and return to his own land; then I will cause him to die by the sword in his own land.’”

8.verse: Rav-Shakeh returned and, having heard that the king of Ashur had left Lakhish, found him making war with Livnah.

9.verse: Then he heard it said that Tirhakah king of Ethiopia was on his way to fight him. On hearing this, the king of Ashur sent messengers to Hizkiyahu, after ordering them,

10.verse: “This is what you are to say to Hizkiyahu king of Y’hudah: ‘Don’t let your God in whom you trust deceive you by saying, “Yerushalayim will not be handed over to the power of the king of Ashur.”

11.verse: You have heard what the kings of Ashur have done to all lands — they have completely destroyed them. So how will you be delivered?

12.verse: Have the gods of the nations delivered them? No, my ancestors destroyed them — Gozan, Haran, Retzef and the people of ‘Eden who were in Tel’asar.

13.verse: Where is the king of Hamat? the king of Arpad? the king of the city of S’farvayim, of Hena and ‘Ivah?’”

14.verse: Hizkiyahu took the letter from the messengers’ hands and read it. Then Hizkiyahu went up to the house of ADONAI and spread it out before ADONAI.

15.verse: This is the prayer that Hizkiyahu prayed to ADONAI:

16.verse: “ADONAI-Tzva’ot, God of Isra’el, who dwells above the k’ruvim! You alone are God of all the kingdoms on earth. You made heaven and earth.

17.verse: Turn your ear, ADONAI, and hear! Open your eyes, ADONAI, and see! Hear all the words that Sancheriv sent to taunt the living God.

18.verse: It is true that the kings of Ashur have laid waste all the countries and their lands

19.verse: and have thrown their gods into the fire. For those were non-gods, merely the products of people’s hands, wood and stone; this is why they could destroy them.

20.verse: Now therefore, ADONAI our God, save us from his power — so that all the kingdoms on earth will know that you are ADONAI — you only.”

21.verse: Then Yesha‘yahu the son of Amotz sent this message to Hizkiyahu: “ADONAI the God of Isra’el says: ‘You prayed to me against Sancheriv king of Ashur.’

22.verse: Here is ADONAI’s answer concerning him: “ ‘The virgin daughter of Tziyon despises you; she laughs you to scorn. The daughter of Yerushalayim shakes her head at you.

23.verse: Whom have you taunted and insulted? Against whom have you raised your voice and haughtily lifted your eyes? The Holy One of Isra’el!

24.verse: “ ‘Through your servants you taunted Adonai. You said, “With my many chariots I have ascended the mountain heights even in the far reaches of the L’vanon. I cut down its tall cedars and its best cypress trees. I reached its remotest heights and its best forests.

25.verse: I dug [wells] and drank the water. The soles of my [soldiers’] feet dried up all the rivers of Egypt.”

26.verse: “ ‘Haven’t you heard? Long ago I made it; in antiquity I produced it; and now I am making it happen: you are turning fortified cities into heaps of ruins,

27.verse: while their inhabitants, shorn of power, are disheartened and ashamed, weak as grass, frail as plants, like grass on the rooftops or grain scorched by the east wind.

28.verse: “ ‘But I know when you sit, when you leave, when you enter — and when you rage against me.

29.verse: And because of your rage against me, because of your pride that has reached my ears, I am putting my hook in your nose and my bridle on your lips; and I will make you return by the way on which you came.

30.verse: “ ‘This will be the sign for you [people of Isra’el]: this year, you will eat the grain that grows of itself; the second year, you will eat what grows from that; but in the third year, you will sow, reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

31.verse: “ ‘Meanwhile, the remnant of the house of Y’hudah that has escaped will again take root downward and bear fruit upward;

32.verse: for a remnant will go out from Yerushalayim, those escaping will go out from Mount Tziyon. The zeal of ADONAI-Tzva’ot will accomplish this.’

33.verse: “Therefore this is what ADONAI says concerning the king of Ashur: “ ‘He will not come to this city or even shoot an arrow there; he will not confront it with a shield or erect earthworks against it.

34.verse: “ ‘By the way he came he will return; he will not come to this city,’ says ADONAI.

35.verse: ‘For I will defend this city and save it, both for my own sake and for my servant David’s sake.’ ”

36.verse: Then the angel of ADONAI went out and struck down 185,000 men in the camp of Ashur. Early the next morning, there they were, all of them, corpses — dead.

37.verse: So Sancheriv king of Ashur left, went and returned to live in Ninveh.

38.verse: One day, as he was worshipping in the temple of Nisrokh his god, his sons Adramelekh and Shar’etzer struck him with the sword and escaped into the land of Ararat. So his son Esar-Hadon took his place as king.

1.verse: Around this time Hizkiyahu became ill to the point of death. Yesha‘yahu the prophet, the son of Amotz, came and said to him, “Here is what ADONAI says: ‘Put your house in order, because you are going to die; you will not live.’”

2.verse: Hizkiyahu turned his face toward the wall and prayed to ADONAI:

3.verse: “I plead with you, ADONAI, remember now how I have lived before you truly and wholeheartedly, and how I have done what you see as good.” And he cried bitter tears.

4.verse: Then the word of ADONAI came to Yesha‘yahu:

5.verse: “Go and tell Hizkiyahu that this is what ADONAI, the God of David your ancestor, says: ‘I have heard your prayer and seen your tears; therefore I will add fifteen years to your life.

6.verse: Also I will rescue you and this city from the power of the king of Ashur; I will defend this city.

7.verse: The sign for you from ADONAI that ADONAI will do what he said is

8.verse: that I will cause the shadow of the sundial, which has started going down on the sundial of Achaz, to go backward ten intervals.’” So the sun went back ten intervals of the distance it had already gone down.

9.verse: After Hizkiyahu king of Y’hudah had been ill and had recovered, he wrote the following:

10.verse: “I once said: ‘In the prime of life I am going off to the gates of Sh’ol. I am being deprived of living out the full span of my life.’

11.verse: “I said, ‘I will never again see Yah, Yah in the land of the living; I will look on human beings no more or be with those who live in this world.

12.verse: My home is uprooted and taken away from me like a shepherd’s tent. Like a weaver, I have rolled up my life; he cuts me off from the loom. Between day and night you could finish me off.

13.verse: I try to be strong like a lion till morning, but still my illness breaks all my bones — between day and night you could finish me off.

14.verse: I make little chattering sounds like a swallow, I moan aloud like a dove, My eyes are weary with looking upward. Adonai, I am overwhelmed; guarantee my life!’

15.verse: “What is there that I can say? He has spoken to me and acted! I will go humbly all my years, remembering how bitter I was.

16.verse: Adonai, by these things people live; in all these is the life of my spirit. You’re restoring my health and giving me life —

17.verse: though instead of peace, I felt very bitter. You desired my life and preserved it from the nothingness pit; for you threw all my sins behind your back.

18.verse: “Sh’ol cannot thank you, death cannot praise you; those descending to the pit cannot hope for your truth.

19.verse: The living, the living — they can thank you, as I do today; fathers will make their children know about your faithfulness.

20.verse: ADONAI is ready to save me; hence we will make our stringed instruments sound all the days of our life in the house of ADONAI.”

21.verse: Then Yesha‘yahu said, “Have them take a fig-plaster and apply it to the inflammation, and he will recover.”

22.verse: Hizkiyahu asked, “What sign will there be that I will be able to go up to the house of ADONAI?”

1.verse: M’rodakh-Bal’adan the son of Bal’adan, king of Bavel, heard that Hizkiyahu had been ill and had recovered, so he sent a letter and a gift to him.

2.verse: Hizkiyahu was pleased with the gifts and showed the messengers all of the building where he kept his treasures, including the silver, gold, spices and precious oils; also all of the building where he kept his armor; and everything in his treasury — there was nothing in his palace or in his entire domain that Hizkiyahu did not show them.

3.verse: Then Yesha‘yahu the prophet came to King Hizkiyahu and asked him, “What did these men say? Where did they come from?” Hizkiyahu answered, “They came to me from a distant country, Bavel.”

4.verse: Yesha‘yahu asked, “What have they seen in your palace?” “They have seen everything in my palace,” said Hizkiyahu. “There isn’t a thing among my treasures that I haven’t shown them.”

5.verse: Yesha‘yahu said to Hizkiyahu, “Hear what ADONAI-Tzva’ot says:

6.verse: ‘The day will come when everything in your palace, along with everything your ancestors stored up until today, will be carried off to Bavel. Nothing will be left,’ says ADONAI.

7.verse: ‘They will carry off some of your descendants, your own offspring; and they will be made eunuchs serving in the palace of the king of Bavel.”

8.verse: Hizkiyahu said to Yesha‘yahu, “The word of ADONAI which you have just told me is good”; because he thought, “At least peace and truth will continue during my lifetime.”

1.verse: “Comfort and keep comforting my people,” says your God.

2.verse: “Tell Yerushalayim to take heart; proclaim to her that she has completed her time of service, that her guilt has been paid off, that she has received at the hand of ADONAI double for all her sins.”

3.verse: A voice cries out: “Clear a road through the desert for ADONAI! Level a highway in the ‘Aravah for our God!

4.verse: Let every valley be filled in, every mountain and hill lowered, the bumpy places made level and the crags become a plain.

5.verse: Then the glory of ADONAI will be revealed; all humankind together will see it, for the mouth of ADONAI has spoken.”

6.verse: A voice says, “Proclaim!” And I answer, “What should I proclaim?” “All humanity is merely grass, all its kindness like wildflowers:

7.verse: the grass dries up, the flower fades, when a wind from ADONAI blows on it. Surely the people are grass!

8.verse: The grass dries up, the flower fades; but the word of our God will stand forever.”

9.verse: You who bring good news to Tziyon, get yourself up on a high mountain; you who bring good news to Yerushalayim, cry out at the top of your voice! Don’t be afraid to shout out loud! Say to the cities of Y’hudah, “Here is your God!

10.verse: Here comes Adonai ELOHIM with power, and his arm will rule for him. Look! His reward is with him, and his recompense is before him.

11.verse: He is like a shepherd feeding his flock, gathering his lambs with his arm, carrying them against his chest, gently leading the mother sheep.”

12.verse: Who has counted the handfuls of water in the sea, measured off the sky with a ruler, gauged how much dust there is on the earth, weighed the mountains on scales, or the hills in a balance?

13.verse: Who has measured the Spirit of ADONAI? Who has been his counselor, instructing him?

14.verse: Whom did he consult, to gain understanding? Who taught him how to judge, taught him what he needed to know, showed him how to discern?

15.verse: The nations are like a drop in a bucket, they count like a grain of dust on the scales. The islands weigh as little as specks of dust.

16.verse: The L’vanon would not suffice for fuel or its animals be enough for burnt offerings.

17.verse: Before him all the nations are like nothing. He regards them as less than nothing.

18.verse: With whom, then, will you compare God? By what standard will you evaluate him?

19.verse: An image made by a craftsman, which a goldsmith overlays with gold, for which he then casts silver chains?

20.verse: A man too poor to afford an offering chooses a piece of wood that won’t rot, then seeks out a skilled artisan to prepare an image that won’t fall over.

21.verse: Don’t you know? Don’t you hear? Haven’t you been told from the start? Don’t you understand how the earth is set up?

22.verse: He who sits above the circle of the earth — for whom its inhabitants appear like grasshoppers — stretches out the heavens like a curtain, spreads them out like a tent to live in.

23.verse: He reduces princes to nothing, the rulers of the earth to emptiness.

24.verse: Scarcely are they planted, scarcely sown, scarcely their stem taken root in the ground, when he blows on them, they dry up, and the whirlwind carries them off like straw.

25.verse: “With whom, then, will you compare me? With whom am I equal?” asks the Holy One.

26.verse: Turn your eyes to the heavens! See who created these? He brings out the army of them in sequence, summoning each by name. Through his great might and his massive strength, not one of them is missing.

27.verse: Why do you complain, Ya‘akov; why do you say, Isra’el, “My way is hidden from ADONAI, my rights are ignored by my God”?

28.verse: Haven’t you known, haven’t you heard that the everlasting God, ADONAI, the Creator of the ends of the earth, does not grow tired or weary? His understanding cannot be fathomed.

29.verse: He invigorates the exhausted, he gives strength to the powerless.

30.verse: Young men may grow tired and weary, even the fittest may stumble and fall;

31.verse: but those who hope in ADONAI will renew their strength, they will soar aloft as with eagles’ wings; when they are running they won’t grow weary, when they are walking they won’t get tired.

1.verse: “Keep silence before me, coastlands! Let the peoples replenish their strength! Let them approach; then let them speak. Let us assemble for judgment.”

2.verse: Who has raised from the east one who is just and called him to be in his service? He hands nations over to him and subjects kings to him; his sword reduces them to dust, his bow to driven straw.

3.verse: He pursues them, passing on unscathed, hardly touching the path with his feet.

4.verse: Whose work is this? Who has brought it about? He who called the generations from the beginning, “I, ADONAI, am the first; and I am the same with those who are last.”

5.verse: The coastlands have seen and became afraid. The ends of the earth have trembled. They have approached, and now they have come.

6.verse: Every one helps his fellow workman, everyone says to his brother, “Be strong!”

7.verse: The woodworker encourages the goldsmith, the polisher encourages the hammerer; he says of the soldering, “Yes, that’s good,” then puts nails in [the idol] to keep it from moving.

8.verse: “But you, Isra’el, my servant; Ya‘akov, whom I have chosen, descendants of Avraham my friend,

9.verse: I have taken you from the ends of the earth, summoned you from its most distant parts and said to you, ‘You are my servant’ — I have chosen you, not rejected you.

10.verse: Don’t be afraid, for I am with you; don’t be distressed, for I am your God. I give you strength, I give you help, I support you with my victorious right hand.

11.verse: All those who were angry with you will be disgraced, put to shame; those who fought against you will be destroyed, brought to nothing.

12.verse: You will seek them but not find them, those who contended with you; yes, those who made war with you will be brought to nothing, nothing at all.

13.verse: For I, ADONAI, your God, say to you, as I hold your right hand, ‘Have no fear; I will help you.

14.verse: Have no fear, Ya‘akov, you worm, you men of Isra’el!’ I will help you,” says ADONAI; “Your redeemer is the Holy One of Isra’el.

15.verse: “I will make you into a threshing-sledge, new, with sharp, pointed teeth, to thresh the mountains and crush them to dust, to reduce the hills to chaff.

16.verse: As you fan them, the wind will carry them off, and the whirlwind will scatter them. Then you will rejoice in ADONAI, you will glory in the Holy One of Isra’el.

17.verse: “The poor and needy look for water in vain; their tongues are parched with thirst. I, ADONAI, will answer them. I, the God of Isra’el, will not leave them.

18.verse: I will open up rivers on the barren hills and wells down in the broad valleys. I will turn the desert into a lake and dry ground into springs.

19.verse: I will plant the desert with cedars, acacias, myrtles and olive trees; In the ‘Aravah I will put cypresses together with elm trees and larches.”

20.verse: Then the people will see and know, together observe and understand that the hand of ADONAI has done this, that the Holy One of Isra’el created it.

21.verse: “Present your case,” says ADONAI, “Produce your arguments,” says Ya‘akov’s king.

22.verse: Bring out those idols! Have them foretell the future for us, tell us about past events, so that we can reflect on them and understand their consequences. Or tell us about events yet to come,

23.verse: state what will happen in the future, so that we can know you are gods. At least, do something, either good or bad — anything, to make us awestruck and fearful!

24.verse: You can’t! — because you are less than nothing. Whoever chooses you is an abomination!

25.verse: “I roused someone from the north, and he has come from the rising sun; he will call on my name. He will trample on rulers as if they were mud, like a potter treading clay.”

26.verse: Who said this at the start, so we could know, or foretold it, so we could say, “He’s right”? In fact, no one said it; no one foretold it — the fact is, nobody hears what you say.

27.verse: I am the first to declare it to Tziyon, to send Yerushalayim a messenger with good news.

28.verse: But when I look around, there is no one — not a single one can give counsel, who, when I ask, can give an answer.

29.verse: Look at them all! What they do is nothing! Their idols are so much wind and waste.

1.verse: “Here is my servant, whom I support, my chosen one, in whom I take pleasure. I have put my Spirit on him; he will bring justice to the Goyim.

2.verse: He will not cry or shout; no one will hear his voice in the streets.

3.verse: He will not snap off a broken reed or snuff out a smoldering wick. He will bring forth justice according to truth;

4.verse: he will not weaken or be crushed until he has established justice on the earth, and the coastlands wait for his Torah.”

5.verse: Thus says God, ADONAI, who created the heavens and spread them out, who stretched out the earth and all that grows from it, who gives breath to the people on it and spirit to those who walk on it:

6.verse: “I, ADONAI, called you righteously, I took hold of you by the hand, I shaped you and made you a covenant for the people, to be a light for the Goyim,

7.verse: so that you can open blind eyes, free the prisoners from confinement, those living in darkness from the dungeon.

8.verse: I am ADONAI; that is my name. I yield my glory to no one else, nor my praise to any idol.

9.verse: See how the former predictions come true; and now new things do I declare — before they sprout I tell you about them.”

10.verse: Sing to ADONAI a new song! Let his praise be sung from the ends of the earth by those sailing the sea and by everything in it, by the coastlands and those living there.

11.verse: Let the desert and its cities raise their voices, the villages where Kedar lives; let those living in Sela shout for joy; let them cry out from the mountaintops!

12.verse: Let them give glory to ADONAI and proclaim his praise in the coastlands.

13.verse: ADONAI will go out like a soldier, like a soldier roused to the fury of battle; he will shout, yes, he raises the battle cry; as he triumphs over his foes.

14.verse: “For a long time I have held my peace, I have been silent, restrained myself. Now I will shriek like a woman in labor, panting and gasping for air.

15.verse: I will devastate mountains and hills, wither all their vegetation, turn the rivers into islands and dry up the lakes.

16.verse: The blind I will lead on a road they don’t know, on roads they don’t know I will lead them; I will turn darkness to light before them, and straighten their twisted paths. These are things I will do without fail.

17.verse: Those who trust in idols, who say to statues, ‘You are our gods,’ will be repulsed in utter shame.

18.verse: Listen, you deaf! Look, you blind! — so that you will see!

19.verse: Who is as blind as my servant, or as deaf as the messenger I send? Who is as blind as the one I rewarded, as blind as the servant of ADONAI?”

20.verse: You see much but don’t pay attention; you open your ears, but you don’t listen.

21.verse: ADONAI was pleased, for his righteousness’ sake, to make the Torah great and glorious.

22.verse: But this is a people pillaged and plundered, all trapped in holes and sequestered in prisons. They are there to be plundered, with no one to rescue them; there to be pillaged, and no one says, “Return them!”

23.verse: Which of you will listen to this? Who will hear and give heed in the times to come?

24.verse: Who gave Ya‘akov to be pillaged, Isra’el to the plunderers? Didn’t ADONAI, against whom we have sinned, in whose ways they refused to walk, he whose Torah they did not obey?

25.verse: This is why he poured on him his blazing anger as well as the fury of battle — it wrapped him in flames, yet he learned nothing; it burned him, yet he did not take it to heart.

1.verse: But now this is what ADONAI says, he who created you, Ya‘akov, he who formed you, Isra’el: “Don’t be afraid, for I have redeemed you; I am calling you by your name; you are mine.

2.verse: When you pass through water, I will be with you; when you pass through rivers, they will not overwhelm you; when you walk through fire, you will not be scorched — the flame will not burn you.

3.verse: For I am ADONAI, your God, the Holy One of Isra’el, your Savior — I have given Egypt as your ransom, Ethiopia and S’va for you.

4.verse: Because I regard you as valued and honored, and because I love you. For you I will give people, nations in exchange for your life.

5.verse: Don’t be afraid, for I am with you. I will bring your descendants from the east, and I will gather you from the west;

6.verse: I will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’ and to the south, ‘Don’t hold them back! Bring my sons from far away, and my daughters from the ends of the earth,

7.verse: everyone who bears my name, whom I created for my glory — I formed him, yes, I made him.’”

8.verse: Bring forward the people who are blind but have eyes, also the deaf who have ears.

9.verse: All the nations are gathered together, and the peoples are assembled. Who among them can proclaim this and reveal what happened in the past? Let them bring their witnesses to justify themselves, so that others, on hearing, can say, “That’s true.”

10.verse: “You are my witnesses,” says ADONAI, “and my servant whom I have chosen, so that you can know and trust me and understand that I am he — no god was produced before me, nor will any be after me.

11.verse: I, yes I, am ADONAI; besides me there is no deliverer.

12.verse: I have declared, saved and proclaimed — not some alien god among you. Therefore you are my witnesses,” says ADONAI. “I am God.

13.verse: Since days began, I have been he. No one can deliver from my hand. When I act, who can reverse it?”

14.verse: Here is what ADONAI, your redeemer, the Holy One of Isra’el, says: “For your sake I have sent [an army] to Bavel and knocked down the fleeing Kasdim, all of them; their songs of triumph are now lamentations.

15.verse: I am ADONAI, your Holy One, the Creator of Isra’el, your King.”

16.verse: Here is what ADONAI says, who made a way in the sea, a path through the raging waves;

17.verse: who led out chariot and horse, the army in its strength — they lay down, never to rise again, snuffed out and quenched like a wick:

18.verse: “Stop dwelling on past events and brooding over times gone by;

19.verse: I am doing something new; it’s springing up — can’t you see it? I am making a road in the desert, rivers in the wasteland.

20.verse: The wild animals will honor me, the jackals and the ostriches; because I put water in the desert, rivers in the wasteland, for my chosen people to drink,

21.verse: the people I formed for myself, so that they would proclaim my praise.

22.verse: But you haven’t called on me, Ya‘akov; because you have grown weary of me, Isra’el.

23.verse: You have not brought me sheep for your burnt offerings, you have not honored me with your sacrifices. I didn’t burden you by requiring grain offerings. or weary you by demanding frankincense.

24.verse: You have not spent money to buy me sweet cane or filled me with the fat of your sacrifices. Instead, you have burdened me with your sins and wearied me with your crimes.

25.verse: I, yes I, am the one who blots out your offenses for my own sake; I will not remember your sins.

26.verse: Remind me when we’re in court together — tell your side, make the case that you are right.

27.verse: Your first father sinned, and your spokesmen rebelled against me.

28.verse: Therefore I repudiated the officials of the sanctuary, delivered Ya‘akov to the curse of destruction, and subjected Isra’el to scorn.

1.verse: “Now listen, Ya‘akov my servant, Isra’el whom I have chosen:

2.verse: Thus says ADONAI, who made you, formed you in the womb, and will help you: Don’t be afraid, Ya‘akov my servant, Yeshurun, whom I have chosen.

3.verse: For I will pour water on the thirsty land and streams on the dry ground; I will pour my Spirit on your descendants, my blessing on your offspring.

4.verse: They will spring up among the grass like willows on the riverbanks.

5.verse: One will say, ‘I belong to ADONAI.’ Another will be called by the name of Ya‘akov. Yet another will write that he belongs to ADONAI. and adopt the surname Isra’el.”

6.verse: Thus says ADONAI, Isra’el’s King and Redeemer, ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “I am the first, and I am the last; besides me there is no God.

7.verse: Who is like me? Let him speak out! Let him show me clearly what has been happening since I set up the eternal people; let him foretell future signs and events.

8.verse: Don’t be frightened, don’t be afraid — Didn’t I tell you this long ago? I foretold it, and you are my witnesses. Is there any God besides me? There is no other Rock — I know of none.”

9.verse: All idol-makers amount to nothing; their precious productions profit no one; and their witnesses, to their own shame, neither see nor understand.

10.verse: Who would fashion a god or cast an image that profits no one anything?

11.verse: All involved will be ashamed, but more than anyone else, the people who made them. Let them all be assembled, let them stand up; let them fear and be shamed together.

12.verse: A blacksmith makes a tool over burning coals; with his strong arm he shapes it with hammers. But when he gets hungry, his strength fails; if he doesn’t drink water, he grows tired.

13.verse: A carpenter takes his measurements, sketches the shape with a stylus, planes the wood, checks it with calipers, and carves it into the shape of a man; and, since it is honored like a man, of course it has to live in a house.

14.verse: He goes to chop down cedars; he takes an evergreen and an oak; he especially tends one tree in the forest, plants a pine for the rain to nourish.

15.verse: In time, when it’s ready for use as fuel, he takes some of it to keep himself warm and burns some more to bake bread. Then he makes a god and worships it, carves it into an idol and falls down before it.

16.verse: So half of it he burns in the fire; with that half he roasts meat and eats his fill; he warms himself; says, “It feels so good, getting warm while watching the flames!”

17.verse: With the rest of the log he fashions a god, a carved image, then falls down before it; he worships it and prays to it. “Save me,” he says, “for you are my god!”

18.verse: Such people know nothing, understand nothing. Their eyes are sealed shut, so that they can’t see; their hearts too, so they can’t understand.

19.verse: Not one thinks to himself or has the knowledge or the discernment to say, “I burned half of it in the fire, baked bread on its coals, roasted meat and ate it. Should I now make the rest an abomination? Should I prostrate myself to a tree trunk?”

20.verse: He is relying on ashes! A deceived heart has led him astray; so that now he won’t save himself, just won’t say, “This thing in my hand is a fraud!”

21.verse: “Keep these matters in mind, Ya‘akov, for you, Isra’el, are my servant. I formed you, you are my own servant; Isra’el, don’t forget me.

22.verse: Like a thick cloud, I wipe away your offenses; like a cloud, your sins. Come back to me, for I have redeemed you.”

23.verse: Sing, you heavens, for ADONAI has done it! Shout, you depths of the earth! Mountains, break out into song, along with every tree in the forest! For ADONAI has redeemed Ya‘akov; he glorifies himself in Isra’el.

24.verse: Here is what ADONAI says, your Redeemer, he who formed you in the womb: “I am ADONAI, who makes all things, who stretched out the heavens all alone, who spread out the earth all by myself.

25.verse: I frustrate false prophets and their omens, I make fools of diviners, I drive back the sages and make their wisdom look silly.

26.verse: I confirm my servants’ prophecies and make my messengers’ plans succeed. I say of Yerushalayim: ‘She will be lived in,’ of the cities of Y’hudah, ‘They will be rebuilt; I will restore their ruins.’

27.verse: I say to the deep sea, ‘Dry up! I will make your streams run dry.’

28.verse: I say of Koresh, ‘He is my shepherd, he will do everything I want. He will say of Yerushalayim, “You will be rebuilt,” and of the temple, “Your foundation will be laid.”’”

1.verse: Thus says ADONAI to Koresh, his anointed, whose right hand he has grasped, so that he subdues nations before him and strips kings of their robes, so that doors open in front of him, and no gates are barred:

2.verse: “I will go ahead of you, levelling the hills, shattering the bronze gates, smashing the iron bars.

3.verse: I will give you treasures hoarded in the dark, secret riches hidden away, so that you will know that I, ADONAI, calling you by your name, am the God of Isra’el.

4.verse: It is for the sake of Ya‘akov my servant, yes, for Isra’el my elect, that I call you by your name and give you a title, although you don’t know me.

5.verse: I am ADONAI; there is no other; besides me there is no God. I am arming you, although you don’t know me,

6.verse: so that those from the east and those from the west will know that there is none besides me — I am ADONAI; there is no other.

7.verse: I form light, I create darkness; I make well-being, I create woe; I, ADONAI, do all these things.

8.verse: “Heavens above, rain down justice; let the clouds pour it down. Let the earth open, so that salvation springs up, and justice sprouts with it. I, ADONAI, have created it.”

9.verse: Woe to anyone who argues with his maker, like potsherds lying on the ground! Does the clay ask the potter, “What are you doing?” or, “What’s this you’re making, that has no hands?”

10.verse: Woe to him who asks a father, “Of what are you the father?” or who asks a woman, “To what are you giving birth?”

11.verse: Thus says ADONAI, the Holy One of Isra’el, his Maker: “You ask for signs concerning my children? You give orders concerning the work of my hands?

12.verse: I am the one who made the earth! I created human beings on it! I — my hands — stretched out the heavens, and directed all their number.

13.verse: I am stirring up Koresh to righteousness, I am smoothing out all his paths. He will rebuild my city; and he will free my exiles, taking neither ransom nor bribe,” says ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

14.verse: Here is what ADONAI says: “The earnings of Egypt, the commerce of Ethiopia, and men of stature from S’va will come over to you and become yours; they will come in chains and follow you. They will prostrate themselves before you; they will pray to you: ‘Surely God is with you; there is no other, other gods are nothing.’”

15.verse: Truly, you are a God who hides himself, God of Isra’el, Savior!

16.verse: The idol-makers will be ashamed, disgraced, all of them; they will go dishonored together.

17.verse: But Isra’el, saved by ADONAI with an everlasting salvation, you will never, ever, be ashamed or disgraced.

18.verse: For thus says ADONAI, who created the heavens, God, who shaped and made the earth, who established and created it not to be chaos, but formed it to be lived in: “I am ADONAI; there is no other.

19.verse: I did not speak in secret, in a land of darkness. I did not say to the descendants of Ya‘akov, ‘It is in vain that you will seek me.’ I, ADONAI, speak rightly; I say what is true.

20.verse: Assemble, come and gather together, you refugees from the nations! Those carrying their wooden idols are ignorant, they pray to a god that cannot save.

21.verse: Let them stand and present their case! Indeed, let them take counsel together. Who foretold this long ago, announced it in times gone by? Wasn’t it I, ADONAI? There is no other God besides me, a just God and a Savior; there is none besides me.

22.verse: Look to me, and be saved, all the ends of the earth! For I am God; there is no other.

23.verse: In the name of myself I have sworn, from my mouth has rightly gone out, a word that will not return — that to me every knee will bow and every tongue will swear

24.verse: about me that only in ADONAI are justice and strength.” All who rage against him will come to him ashamed,

25.verse: but all the descendants of Isra’el will find justice and glory in ADONAI.

1.verse: Bel bows down, N’vo stoops low; their idols are borne by animals, beasts of burden. The loads you yourselves were carrying are now burdening tired animals.

2.verse: They stoop and bow down together; they cannot save the burden, but themselves go into captivity.

3.verse: “Listen to me, house of Ya‘akov, all who remain of the house of Isra’el: I have borne you from birth, carried you since the womb.

4.verse: Till your old age I will be the same — I will carry you until your hair is white. I have made you, and I will bear you; yes, I will carry and save you.

5.verse: To whom will you liken me and equate me? With whom will you compare me, as if we were similar?”

6.verse: They squander the gold from their bags and weigh silver on a scale; they hire a goldsmith to make a god, before which they fall down and worship!

7.verse: It is borne on shoulders and carried, then set in its place; and there it stands. From its place it does not move. If one cries to it, it cannot answer or save anyone from his troubles.

8.verse: Remember this, and stand firm. Keep it in mind, you rebels.

9.verse: “Remember things that happened at the beginning, long ago — that I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is none like me.

10.verse: At the beginning I announce the end, proclaim in advance things not yet done; and I say that my plan will hold, I will do everything I please to do.

11.verse: I call a bird of prey from the east, the man I intended, from a distant country. I have spoken and will bring it about; I have made a plan, and I will fulfill it.

12.verse: Listen to me, you stubborn people, so far from righteousness:

13.verse: I am bringing my justice nearer, it is not far away; my salvation will not be delayed, I will place my salvation in Tziyon for Isra’el my glory.

1.verse: “Come down, and sit in the dust, you virgin daughter of Bavel! Sit on the ground, not on a throne, daughter of the Kasdim! No longer are you to be called dainty and delicate.

2.verse: Take the millstones, and grind meal; take off your veil, strip off your skirt, uncover your legs, wade through the streams.

3.verse: Your private parts will be exposed; yes, your shame will be seen. I am going to take vengeance, and no one will stand in my way.”

4.verse: Our Redeemer! ADONAI-Tzva’ot is his name, the Holy One of Isra’el!

5.verse: “Sit there speechless, go into darkness, you daughter of the Kasdim! For you will no longer be called the mistress of kingdoms.

6.verse: I was angry with my people, I desecrated my own possession and gave them over to you. But you showed them no mercy; you made your yoke very heavy, even upon the aged.

7.verse: You said, ‘I will be mistress forever.’ so you didn’t consider these things or think about the consequences.

8.verse: Now hear this, you lover of luxuries, lolling at ease and saying to yourself, ‘I am important, and no one else! I will never be a widow or know the loss of children.’

9.verse: But both will come over you in an instant, in a single day loss of children and widowhood; they will utterly overwhelm you, despite your many occult practices and powerful spells to prevent it.”

10.verse: You were at ease in your wickedness, you thought, “No one sees me.” Your “wisdom” and “knowledge” perverted you, as you thought to yourself, “I am important, and no one else.”

11.verse: Yet disaster will befall you, and you won’t know how to charm it away; calamity will come upon you, and you won’t be able to turn it aside; ruin will overcome you, suddenly, before you know it.

12.verse: So for now, keep on with your powerful spells and your many occult practices; from childhood you have been working at them; maybe they will do you some good, maybe you will inspire terror!

13.verse: You are worn out with all your consultations — so let the astrologers and stargazers, the monthly horoscope-makers, come forward now and save you from the things that will come upon you!

14.verse: Look, they will be like straw! The fire will consume them. They will not save even themselves from the power of the flame. It will not be coals for warming oneself, not a fire to sit beside!

15.verse: So much for your [wizards], with whom you have worked all your life! Each will wander off in his own direction, and nobody will save you.

1.verse: Listen to this, house of Ya‘akov, called by the name of Isra’el, who have come from the spring of Y’hudah, who swear by the name of ADONAI and invoke the God of Isra’el! — it is not sincerely or justifiably

2.verse: that they call themselves people of the holy city or rely on the God of Isra’el — ADONAI-Tzva’ot is his name:

3.verse: “I announced things that happened at the beginning, long ago; they issued from my mouth, I proclaimed them. Then suddenly I acted, and they occurred.

4.verse: Because I knew that you were stubborn, your neck an iron sinew, your forehead bronze,

5.verse: I announced it to you long ago; before it occurred, I proclaimed it to you; so that you could not say, ‘My idol did it; my carved image, my statue, gave the order for it.’

6.verse: You have heard and seen all this, so why won’t you admit it? “Now I am announcing new things to you, secret things you have not known,

7.verse: created now, not long ago; before today, you did not hear them: so you can’t say, ‘I already know about them.’

8.verse: No, you haven’t heard, and you haven’t known; these things have not reached your ears before. For I knew how treacherous you were — you were called a rebel from the womb.

9.verse: Yet for the sake of my own reputation I am deferring my anger; for the sake of my praise I am patient with you, so as not to cut you off.

10.verse: “Look, I have refined you, but not [as severely] as silver; [rather] I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.

11.verse: For my sake I will do it, for my own sake. I will not let [my reputation] be tarnished; I will not yield my glory to anyone else.

12.verse: “Listen to me, Ya‘akov; Isra’el, whom I have called: I am he who is first; I am also the last.

13.verse: My hand laid the foundation of the earth, my right hand spread out the heavens; when I summoned them, at once they rose into being.

14.verse: “All of you, assemble and listen: which of you has foretold what is coming? ADONAI’s friend will do his will against Bavel, using his arm against the Kasdim.

15.verse: It is I who have spoken, I have summoned him, I have brought him, and he will succeed.

16.verse: “Come close to me, and listen to this: since the beginning I have not spoken in secret, since the time things began to be, I have been there; and now Adonai ELOHIM has sent me and his Spirit.”

17.verse: Thus says ADONAI, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Isra’el: “I am ADONAI, your God, who teaches you for your own good, who guides you on the path you should take.

18.verse: If only you would heed my mitzvot! Then your peace would flow on like a river, and your righteousness like the waves of the sea.

19.verse: Your descendants would be numerous as the sand, your offspring countless as its grains. Their name would never be cut off or destroyed from my presence.”

20.verse: Get out of Bavel! Flee the Kasdim! With shouts of joy announce it, proclaim it! Send the news out to the ends of the earth! Say, “ADONAI has redeemed his servant Ya‘akov.”

21.verse: They weren’t thirsty when he led them through the deserts, he made water flow from the rock for them — he split the rock, and out gushed the water.

22.verse: But there is no peace, says ADONAI, for the wicked.

1.verse: Coastlands, listen to me; listen, you peoples far away: ADONAI called me from the womb; before I was born, he had spoken my name.

2.verse: He has made my mouth like a sharp sword while hiding me in the shadow of his hand; he has made me like a sharpened arrow while concealing me in his quiver.

3.verse: He said to me, “You are my servant, Isra’el, through whom I will show my glory.”

4.verse: But I said, “I have toiled in vain, spent my strength for nothing, futility.” Yet my cause is with ADONAI, my reward is with my God.

5.verse: So now ADONAI says — he formed me in the womb to be his servant, to bring Ya‘akov back to him, to have Isra’el gathered to him, so that I will be honored in the sight of ADONAI, my God having become my strength —

6.verse: he has said, “It is not enough that you are merely my servant to raise up the tribes of Ya‘akov and restore the offspring of Isra’el. I will also make you a light to the nations, so my salvation can spread to the ends of the earth.”

7.verse: Here is what ADONAI, the Redeemer of Isra’el, his Holy One, says to the one despised, whom the nations detest, to the servant of tyrants: “When kings see you, they will stand up; princes too will prostrate themselves, because of ADONAI, who is faithful, the Holy One of Isra’el, who has chosen you.”

8.verse: Here is what ADONAI says: “At the time when I choose, I will answer you; on the day of salvation, I will help you. I have preserved you, and I have appointed you to be the covenant for a people, to restore the land and distribute again its ruined inheritances to their owners,

9.verse: to say to the prisoners, ‘Come out!’ to those in darkness, ‘Show yourselves!’ They will feed along the paths, and all the high hills will be their pastures.

10.verse: They will be neither hungry nor thirsty; neither scorching wind nor sun will strike them; for he who has mercy on them will lead them and guide them to springs of water.

11.verse: I will turn all my mountains into a road, my highways will be raised up.

12.verse: There they come, some from far away, some from the north, some from the west, and some from the land of Sinim.”

13.verse: Sing, heaven! Rejoice, earth! Break out in song, you mountains! For ADONAI is comforting his people, having mercy on his own who have suffered.

14.verse: “But Tziyon says, ‘ADONAI has abandoned me, Adonai has forgotten me.’

15.verse: Can a woman forget her child at the breast, not show pity on the child from her womb? Even if these were to forget, I would not forget you.

16.verse: I have engraved you on the palms of my hands, your walls are always before me.”

17.verse: Your children are coming quickly, your destroyers and plunderers are leaving and going.

18.verse: Raise your eyes, and look around: they are all gathering and coming to you. ADONAI swears: “As surely as I am alive, you will wear them all like jewels, adorn yourself with them like a bride.”

19.verse: For your desolate places and ruins and your devastated land will be too cramped for those living in it; your devourers will be far away.

20.verse: The day will come when the children born when you were mourning will say to you, “This place is too cramped for me! Give me room, so I can live!”

21.verse: Then you will ask yourself, “Who fathered these for me? I’ve been mourning my children, alone, as an exile, wandering to and fro; so who has raised these? I was left alone, so where have these come from?”

22.verse: Adonai ELOHIM answers: “I am beckoning to the nations, raising my banner for the peoples. They will bring your sons in their arms and carry your daughters on their shoulders.

23.verse: Kings will be your foster-fathers, their princesses your nurses. They will bow to you, face toward the earth, and lick the dust on your feet. Then you will know that I am ADONAI — those who wait for me will not be sorry.”

24.verse: But can booty be wrested from a warrior? Can a victor’s captives be freed?

25.verse: Here is ADONAI’s answer: “Even a warrior’s captives will be snatched away, and the booty of the fearful will be freed. I will fight those who fight you, and I will save your children.

26.verse: I will feed those oppressing you with their own flesh; they will be drunk on their own blood as with wine. Then everyone will know that I, ADONAI, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Ya‘akov.”

1.verse: ADONAI says: “Where is your mother’s divorce document which I gave her when I divorced her? Or: to which of my creditors did I sell you? You were sold because of your sins; because of your crimes was your mother divorced.

2.verse: Why was no one here when I came? Why, when I called, did nobody answer? Is my arm too short to redeem? Have I too little power to save? With my rebuke I dry up the sea; I turn rivers into desert, their fish rot for lack of water and they die of thirst;

3.verse: I dress the heavens in black to mourn and make their covering sackcloth.”

4.verse: Adonai ELOHIM has given me the ability to speak as a man well taught, so that I, with my words, know how to sustain the weary. Each morning he awakens my ear to hear like those who are taught.

5.verse: Adonai ELOHIM has opened my ear, and I neither rebelled nor turned away.

6.verse: I offered my back to those who struck me, my cheeks to those who plucked out my beard; I did not hide my face from insult and spitting.

7.verse: For Adonai ELOHIM will help. This is why no insult can wound me. This is why I have set my face like flint, knowing I will not be put to shame.

8.verse: My vindicator is close by; let whoever dares to accuse me appear with me in court! Let whoever has a case against me step forward!

9.verse: Look, if Adonai ELOHIM helps me, who will dare to condemn me? Here, they are all falling apart like old, moth-eaten clothes.

10.verse: Who among you fears ADONAI? Who obeys what his servant says? Even when he walks in the dark, without any light, he will trust in ADONAI’s reputation and rely on his God.

11.verse: But all of you who are lighting fires and arming yourselves with firebrands: go, walk in the flame of your own fire, among the firebrands you lit! From my hands this [fate] awaits you: you will lie down in torment.

1.verse: “Listen to me, you pursuers of justice, you who seek ADONAI: consider the rock from which you were cut, the quarry from which you were dug —

2.verse: consider Avraham your father and Sarah, who gave birth to you; in that I called him when he was only one person, then blessed him and made him many.

3.verse: For ADONAI will comfort Tziyon, will comfort all her ruined places, will make her desert like ‘Eden, her ‘Aravah like the garden of ADONAI. Joy and gladness will be there, thanksgiving and the sound of music.

4.verse: “Pay attention to me, my people! My nation, listen to me! For Torah will go out from me; I will calm them with my justice as a light for the peoples.

5.verse: My righteousness is at hand, my salvation goes out, my arms will judge the peoples. The coastlands are putting their hope in me, trusting in my arm.

6.verse: “Raise your eyes toward the skies, look at the earth below. The skies will vanish like smoke, the earth will wear out like clothing. Those living on it will die like flies; but my salvation will be forever, and my justice will never end.

7.verse: “Listen to me, you who know justice, you people who have my Torah in your heart: don’t be afraid of people’s taunts, don’t be upset by their insults.

8.verse: For the moth will eat them up like clothing, the worm will eat them like wool; but my justice will be forever, and my salvation for all generations.”

9.verse: Awake! Awake! Arm of ADONAI, clothe yourself with strength! Awake, as in days of old, as in ancient generations! Wasn’t it you who hacked Rahav to pieces, you who pierced the sea monster?*

10.verse: Wasn’t it you who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep; you who made the sea bottom a road for the redeemed to cross?

11.verse: Those ransomed by ADONAI will return and come with singing to Tziyon; on their heads will be everlasting joy. They will acquire gladness and joy, while sorrow and sighing will flee.

12.verse: “I, yes I, am the one who comforts you! Why are you afraid of a man, who must die; of a human being, who will wither like grass?

13.verse: You have forgotten ADONAI, your maker, who stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth. Instead, you are in constant fear all day because of the oppressor’s rage, as he prepares to destroy! But where is the oppressor’s rage?

14.verse: The captive will soon be set free; he will not die and go down to Sh’ol; on the contrary, his food supply will be secure.

15.verse: For I am ADONAI your God, who stirs up the sea, who makes its waves roar — ADONAI-Tzva’ot is my name.

16.verse: I have put my words in your mouth and covered you with the shadow of my hand, in order to plant the skies [anew], lay the foundations of the earth [anew] and say to Tziyon, ‘You are my people.’”

17.verse: Awake! Awake! Stand up, Yerushalayim! At ADONAI’s hand you drank the cup of his fury; you have drained to the dregs the goblet of drunkenness.

18.verse: There is no one to guide her among all the sons she has borne. Not one of all the children she raised is taking her by the hand.

19.verse: These two disasters have overcome you — yet who will grieve with you? — plunder and destruction, famine and sword; by whom can I comfort you?

20.verse: Your children lie helpless at every street corner, like an antelope trapped in a net; they are full of ADONAI’s fury, the rebuke of your God.

21.verse: Therefore, please hear this in your affliction, you who are drunk, but not with wine;

22.verse: this is what your Lord ADONAI says, your God, who defends his people: “Here, I have removed from your hand the cup of drunkenness, the goblet of my fury. You will never drink it again.

23.verse: I will put it in the hands of your tormentors, who said to you, ‘Bend down, so we can trample you,’ and you flattened your back on the ground like a street for them to walk on.”

1.verse: Awake! Awake, Tziyon! Clothe yourself with your strength! Dress in your splendid garments, Yerushalayim, the holy city! For the uncircumcised and the unclean will enter you no more.

2.verse: Shake off the dust! Arise! Be enthroned, Yerushalayim! Loosen the chains on your neck, captive daughter of Tziyon!

3.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “You were sold for nothing, and you will be redeemed without money.”

4.verse: For thus says Adonai ELOHIM: “Long ago my people went down to Egypt to live there as aliens, and Ashur oppressed them for no reason.

5.verse: So now, what should I do here,” asks ADONAI, “since my people were carried off for nothing? Their oppressors are howling,” says ADONAI, “and my name is always being insulted, daily.

6.verse: Therefore my people will know my name; therefore on that day they will know that I, the one speaking — here I am!”

7.verse: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, proclaiming shalom, bringing good news of good things, announcing salvation and saying to Tziyon, “Your God is King!”

8.verse: Listen! Your watchmen are raising their voices, shouting for joy together. For they will see, before their own eyes, ADONAI returning to Tziyon.

9.verse: Break out into joy! Sing together, you ruins of Yerushalayim! For ADONAI has comforted his people, he has redeemed Yerushalayim!

10.verse: ADONAI has bared his holy arm in the sight of every nation, and all the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our God.

11.verse: Leave! Leave! Get out of there! Don’t touch anything unclean! Get out from inside it, and be clean, you who carry ADONAI’s temple equipment.

12.verse: You need not leave in haste, you do not have to flee; for ADONAI will go ahead of you, and the God of Isra’el will also be behind you.

13.verse: “See how my servant will succeed! He will be raised up, exalted, highly honored!

14.verse: Just as many were appalled at him, because he was so disfigured that he didn’t even seem human and simply no longer looked like a man,

15.verse: so now he will startle many nations; because of him, kings will be speechless. For they will see what they had not been told, they will ponder things they had never heard.”

1.verse: Who believes our report? To whom is the arm of ADONAI revealed?

2.verse: For before him he grew up like a young plant, like a root out of dry ground. He was not well-formed or especially handsome; we saw him, but his appearance did not attract us.

3.verse: People despised and avoided him, a man of pains, well acquainted with illness. Like someone from whom people turn their faces, he was despised; we did not value him.

4.verse: In fact, it was our diseases he bore, our pains from which he suffered; yet we regarded him as punished, stricken and afflicted by God.

5.verse: But he was wounded because of our crimes, crushed because of our sins; the disciplining that makes us whole fell on him, and by his bruises* we are healed.

6.verse: We all, like sheep, went astray; we turned, each one, to his own way; yet ADONAI laid on him the guilt of all of us.

7.verse: Though mistreated, he was submissive — he did not open his mouth. Like a lamb led to be slaughtered, like a sheep silent before its shearers, he did not open his mouth.

8.verse: After forcible arrest and sentencing, he was taken away; and none of his generation protested his being cut off from the land of the living for the crimes of my people, who deserved the punishment themselves.

9.verse: He was given a grave among the wicked; in his death he was with a rich man. Although he had done no violence and had said nothing deceptive,

10.verse: yet it pleased ADONAI to crush him with illness, to see if he would present himself as a guilt offering. If he does, he will see his offspring; and he will prolong his days; and at his hand ADONAI’s desire will be accomplished.

11.verse: After this ordeal, he will see satisfaction. “By his knowing [pain and sacrifice], my righteous servant makes many righteous; it is for their sins that he suffers.

12.verse: Therefore I will assign him a share with the great, he will divide the spoil with the mighty, for having exposed himself to death and being counted among the sinners, while actually bearing the sin of many and interceding for the offenders.”

1.verse: “Sing, barren woman who has never had a child! Burst into song, shout for joy, you who have never been in labor! For the deserted wife will have more children than the woman who is living with her husband,” says ADONAI.

2.verse: Enlarge the space for your tent, extend the curtains of your dwelling; do not hold back, lengthen your cords, make your tent pegs firm.

3.verse: For you will spread out to the right and the left, your descendants will possess the nations and inhabit the desolated cities.

4.verse: Don’t be afraid, for you won’t be ashamed; don’t be discouraged, for you won’t be disgraced. You will forget the shame of your youth, no longer remember the dishonor of being widowed.

5.verse: For your husband is your Maker, ADONAI-Tzva’ot is his name. The Holy One of Isra’el is your Redeemer. He will be called the God of all the earth.

6.verse: For ADONAI has called you back like a wife abandoned and grief-stricken; “A wife married in her youth cannot be rejected,” says your God.

7.verse: “Briefly I abandoned you, but with great compassion I am taking you back.

8.verse: I was angry for a moment and hid my face from you; but with everlasting grace I will have compassion on you,” says ADONAI your Redeemer.

9.verse: “For me this is like Noach’s flood. Just as I swore that no flood like Noach’s would ever again cover the earth, so now I swear that never again will I be angry with you or rebuke you.

10.verse: For the mountains may leave and the hills be removed, but my grace will never leave you, and my covenant of peace will not be removed,” says ADONAI, who has compassion on you.

11.verse: “Storm-ravaged [city], unconsoled, I will set your stones in the finest way, lay your foundations with sapphires,

12.verse: make your windows shine with rubies, your gates with garnet, your walls with gemstones.

13.verse: All your children will be taught by ADONAI; your children will have great peace.

14.verse: In righteousness you will be established, far from oppression, with nothing to fear; far from ruin, for it will not come near you.

15.verse: Any alliance that forms against you will not be my doing; whoever tries to form such an alliance will fall because of you.

16.verse: It is I who created the craftsman who blows on the coals and forges weapons suited to their purpose; I also created the destroyer to work havoc.

17.verse: No weapon made will prevail against you. In court you will refute every accusation. The servants of ADONAI inherit all this; the reward for their righteousness is from me,” says ADONAI.

1.verse: “All you who are thirsty, come to the water! You without money, come, buy, and eat! Yes, come! Buy wine and milk without money — it’s free!

2.verse: Why spend money for what isn’t food, your wages for what doesn’t satisfy? Listen carefully to me, and you will eat well, you will enjoy the fat of the land.

3.verse: Open your ears, and come to me; listen well, and you will live — I will make an everlasting covenant with you, the grace I assured David.

4.verse: I have given him as a witness to the peoples, a leader and lawgiver for the peoples.

5.verse: You will summon a nation you do not know, and a nation that doesn’t know you will run to you, for the sake of ADONAI your God, the Holy One of Isra’el, who will glorify you.”

6.verse: Seek ADONAI while he is available, call on him while he is still nearby.

7.verse: Let the wicked person abandon his way and the evil person his thoughts; let him return to ADONAI, and he will have mercy on him; let him return to our God, for he will freely forgive.

8.verse: “For my thoughts are not your thoughts, and your ways are not my ways,” says ADONAI.

9.verse: “As high as the sky is above the earth are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts than your thoughts.

10.verse: For just as rain and snow fall from the sky and do not return there, but water the earth, causing it to bud and produce, giving seed to the sower and bread to the eater;

11.verse: so is my word that goes out from my mouth — it will not return to me unfulfilled; but it will accomplish what I intend, and cause to succeed what I sent it to do.”

12.verse: Yes, you will go out with joy, you will be led forth in peace. As you come, the mountains and hills will burst out into song, and all the trees in the countryside will clap their hands.

13.verse: Cypresses will grow in place of thorns, myrtles will grow instead of briars. This will bring fame to ADONAI as an eternal, imperishable sign.
