1.verse: Here is what ADONAI says: “Observe justice, do what is right, for my salvation is close to coming, my righteousness to being revealed.”

2.verse: Happy is the person who does this, anyone who grasps it firmly, who keeps Shabbat and does not profane it, and keeps himself from doing any evil.

3.verse: A foreigner joining ADONAI should not say, “ADONAI will separate me from his people”; likewise the eunuch should not say, “I am only a dried-up tree.”

4.verse: For here is what ADONAI says: “As for the eunuchs who keep my Shabbats, who choose what pleases me and hold fast to my covenant:

5.verse: in my house, within my walls, I will give them power and a name greater than sons and daughters; I will give him an everlasting name that will not be cut off.

6.verse: “And the foreigners who join themselves to ADONAI to serve him, to love the name of ADONAI, and to be his workers, all who keep Shabbat and do not profane it, and hold fast to my covenant,

7.verse: I will bring them to my holy mountain and make them joyful in my house of prayer; their burnt offerings and sacrifices will be accepted on my altar; for my house will be called a house of prayer for all peoples.”

8.verse: Adonai ELOHIM says, he who gathers Isra’el’s exiles: “There are yet others I will gather, besides those gathered already.”

9.verse: All you wild animals, come and devour, yes, all you animals in the forest!

10.verse: [Isra’el’s] watchmen are, all of them, blind; they don’t know anything. They are all dumb dogs, unable to bark, lying there dreaming, loving to sleep.

11.verse: Greedy dogs, never satisfied — such are the shepherds, unable to understand; they all turn to their own way, each one intent on his own gain:

12.verse: “Come, I’ll get some wine, we’ll fill up on good, strong liquor! Tomorrow will be like today; in fact, it will be even better!”

1.verse: The righteous person perishes, and nobody gives it a thought. Godly men are taken away, and no one understands that the righteous person is taken away from the evil yet to come.

2.verse: Yes, those who live uprightly will have peace as they rest on their couches.

3.verse: “But you, you witches’ children, come here, you spawn of adulterers and whores!

4.verse: Whom are you making fun of? At whom are you laughing and sticking out your tongue? Aren’t you rebellious children, just a brood of liars?

5.verse: You go into heat among the oak trees, under every spreading tree. You kill the children in the valleys under the cracks in the rocks.

6.verse: Your place is among the smooth stones in the vadi; these, these are what you deserve; you pour out drink offerings to them, you offer grain offerings to them. Should I calmly ignore these things?

7.verse: You set up your bed on a high, lofty mountain; you also went up there to offer sacrifices.

8.verse: Behind door and doorpost you set up your [lewd] memorial; then, far from me, you uncovered your bed, climbed up on it and opened it wide, made an agreement with some of them, whose bed you loved when you saw their hand beckoning.

9.verse: You went to the king with scented oil; you added to your perfumes; you sent your envoys far away, even down to Sh’ol.

10.verse: Though worn out by so much travel, you did not say, ‘All hope is gone’; rather, finding your strength renewed, you did not grow weak.

11.verse: Of whom have you been so afraid, so fearful that you lied? But me you don’t remember, you don’t give me a thought! I have held my peace so long that you no longer fear me.

12.verse: I will expose your [so-called] ‘righteousness’; and what you have done won’t help you.

13.verse: When you cry, will those [idols] you gathered rescue you? The wind will carry them all away, a puff of air will take them off. But whoever takes refuge in me will possess the land and inherit my holy mountain.”

14.verse: Then he will say, “Keep building! Keep building! Clear the way! Remove everything blocking my people’s path!”

15.verse: For thus says the High, Exalted One who lives forever, whose name is Holy: “I live in the high and holy place but also with the broken and humble, in order to revive the spirit of the humble and revive the hearts of the broken ones.

16.verse: For I will not fight them forever or always nurse my anger; otherwise their spirits would faint before me, the creatures I myself have made.

17.verse: It was because of their flagrant greed that I was angry and struck them; I hid myself and was angry, but they continued on their own rebellious way.

18.verse: I have seen their ways, and I will heal them; I will lead them and give comfort to them and to those who mourn for them —

19.verse: I will create the right words: ‘Shalom shalom to those far off and to those nearby!’ says ADONAI; ‘I will heal them!’”

20.verse: But the wicked are like the restless sea — unable to be still, its waters toss up mud and dirt.

21.verse: There is no shalom, says my God, for the wicked.

1.verse: Shout out loud! Don’t hold back! Raise your voice like a shofar! Proclaim to my people what rebels they are, to the house of Ya‘akov their sins.

2.verse: “Oh yes, they seek me day after day and [claim to] delight in knowing my ways. As if they were an upright nation that had not abandoned the rulings of their God, they ask me for just rulings and [claim] to take pleasure in closeness to God,

3.verse: [asking,] ‘Why should we fast, if you don’t see? Why mortify ourselves, if you don’t notice?’ “Here is my answer: when you fast, you go about doing whatever you like, while keeping your laborers hard at work.

4.verse: Your fasts lead to quarreling and fighting, to lashing out with violent blows. On a day like today, fasting like yours will not make your voice heard on high.

5.verse: “Is this the sort of fast I want, a day when a person mortifies himself? Is the object to hang your head like a reed and spread sackcloth and ashes under yourself? Is this what you call a fast, a day that pleases ADONAI?

6.verse: “Here is the sort of fast I want — releasing those unjustly bound, untying the thongs of the yoke, letting the oppressed go free, breaking every yoke,

7.verse: sharing your food with the hungry, taking the homeless poor into your house, clothing the naked when you see them, fulfilling your duty to your kinsmen!”

8.verse: Then your light will burst forth like the morning, your new skin will quickly grow over your wound; your righteousness will precede you, and ADONAI’s glory will follow you.

9.verse: Then you will call, and ADONAI will answer; you will cry, and he will say, “Here I am.” If you will remove the yoke from among you, stop false accusation and slander,

10.verse: generously offer food to the hungry and meet the needs of the person in trouble; then your light will rise in the darkness, and your gloom become like noon.

11.verse: ADONAI will always guide you; he will satisfy your needs in the desert, he will renew the strength in your limbs; so that you will be like a watered garden, like a spring whose water never fails.

12.verse: You will rebuild the ancient ruins, raise foundations from ages past, and be called “Repairer of broken walls, Restorer of streets to live in.”

13.verse: “If you hold back your foot on Shabbat from pursuing your own interests on my holy day; if you call Shabbat a delight, ADONAI’s holy day, worth honoring; then honor it by not doing your usual things or pursuing your interests or speaking about them.

14.verse: If you do, you will find delight in ADONAI — I will make you ride on the heights of the land and feed you with the heritage of your ancestor Ya‘akov, for the mouth of ADONAI has spoken.”

1.verse: ADONAI’s arm is not too short to save, nor is his ear too dull to hear.

2.verse: Rather, it is your own crimes that separate you from your God; your sins have hidden his face from you, so that he doesn’t hear.

3.verse: For your hands are stained with blood and your fingers with crime; your lips speak lies, your tongues utter wicked things.

4.verse: No one sues with just cause, no one pleads honestly in court, they trust in empty words and say worthless things; they conceive trouble and give birth to evil.

5.verse: They hatch viper eggs and spin spiderwebs; whoever eats their eggs dies, and the crushed egg hatches a snake.

6.verse: Their webs are useless as clothing, their deeds are useless for wearing; their deeds are deeds of wickedness, their hands produce violence.

7.verse: Their feet run to evil, they rush to shed innocent blood, their thoughts are thoughts of wickedness, their paths lead to havoc and ruin.

8.verse: The way of shalom they do not know, their goings-about obey no law, they make devious paths for themselves; no one treading them will ever know shalom.

9.verse: This is why justice is far from us, and righteousness doesn’t catch up with us; we look for light, but see only darkness, for brightness, but we walk in gloom.

10.verse: We grope for the wall like the blind; like people without eyes we feel our way; we stumble at noonday as if it were dusk, we are in dark places like the dead.

11.verse: We growl, all of us, like bears and moan pitifully like doves; we look for justice, but there is none; for salvation, but it is far from us.

12.verse: For our crimes multiply before you, our sins testify against us; for our crimes are present with us; and our sins, we know them well:

13.verse: rebelling and denying ADONAI, turning away from following our God, talking about oppression and revolt, uttering lies which our hearts have conceived.

14.verse: Thus justice is repelled, righteousness stands apart, at a distance; for truth stumbles in the public court, and uprightness cannot enter.

15.verse: Honesty is lacking, he who leaves evil becomes a target. ADONAI saw it, and it displeased him that there was no justice.

16.verse: He saw that there was no one, was amazed that no one interceded. Therefore his own arm brought him salvation, and his own righteousness sustained him.

17.verse: He put on righteousness as his breastplate, salvation as a helmet on his head; he clothed himself with garments of vengeance and wrapped himself in a mantle of zeal.

18.verse: He repays according to their deeds — fury to his foes, reprisal to his enemies; to the coastlands he will repay their due;

19.verse: in the west they will fear the name of ADONAI, and likewise, in the east, his glory. For he will come like a pent-up stream, impelled by the Spirit of ADONAI.

20.verse: “Then a Redeemer will come to Tziyon, to those in Ya‘akov who turn from rebellion.” So says ADONAI.

21.verse: “And as for me,” says ADONAI, “this is my covenant with them: my Spirit, who rests on you, and my words which I put in your mouth will not depart from your mouth or from the mouth of your children, or from the mouth of your children’s children, now or ever,” says ADONAI.

1.verse: “Arise, shine [Yerushalayim], for your light has come, the glory of ADONAI has risen over you.

2.verse: For although darkness covers the earth and thick darkness the peoples; on you ADONAI will rise; over you will be seen his glory.

3.verse: Nations will go toward your light and kings toward your shining splendor.

4.verse: Raise your eyes and look around: they are all assembling and coming to you; your sons are coming from far off, your daughters being carried on their nurses’ hips.

5.verse: Then you will see and be radiant, your heart will throb and swell with delight; for the riches of the seas will be brought to you, the wealth of nations will come to you.

6.verse: Caravans of camels will cover your land, young camels from Midyan and ‘Eifah, all of them coming from Sh’va, bringing gold and frankincense, and proclaiming the praises of ADONAI.

7.verse: All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered for you, the rams of N’vayot will be at your service; they will come up and be received on my altar, as I glorify my glorious house.

8.verse: “Who are these, flying along like clouds, like doves to their dovecotes?

9.verse: The coastlands are putting their hope in me, with the ‘Tarshish’ ships in the lead, to bring your children from far away, and with them their silver and gold, for the sake of ADONAI your God, the Holy One of Isra’el, who glorifies you.

10.verse: Foreigners will rebuild your walls, their kings will be at your service; for in my anger I struck you, but in my mercy I pity you.

11.verse: Your gates will always be open, they will not be shut by day or by night, so that people can bring you the wealth of nations, with their kings led in procession.

12.verse: For the nation or kingdom that won’t serve you will perish; yes, those nations will be utterly destroyed.

13.verse: “The glory of the L’vanon will come to you, cypresses together with elm trees and larches, to beautify the site of my sanctuary — I will glorify the place where I stand.

14.verse: The children of your oppressors will come and bow low before you, all who despised you will fall at your feet, calling you the city of ADONAI, Tziyon of the Holy One of Isra’el.

15.verse: “In the past you were abandoned and hated, so that no one would even pass through you; but now I will make you the pride of the ages, a joy for many generations.

16.verse: You will drink the milk of nations, you will nurse at royal breasts and know that I, ADONAI, am your Savior, your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Ya‘akov.

17.verse: “For bronze I will bring you gold, for iron I will bring you silver, bronze in place of wood, and iron in place of stones. I will make shalom your governor and righteousness your taskmaster.

18.verse: Violence will no longer be heard in your land, desolation or destruction within your borders; instead, you will call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.

19.verse: “No more will the sun be your light by day, nor will moonlight shine on you; instead ADONAI will be your light forever and your God your glory.

20.verse: No longer will your sun go down; your moon will no longer wane; for ADONAI will be your light forever; your days of mourning will end.

21.verse: All your people will be tzaddikim; they will inherit the land forever; they will be the branch I planted, my handiwork, in which I take pride.

22.verse: The smallest will grow to a thousand, the weakest will become a mighty nation. I, ADONAI, when the right time comes, will quickly bring it about.”

1.verse: The Spirit of Adonai ELOHIM is upon me, because ADONAI has anointed me to announce good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the brokenhearted; to proclaim freedom to the captives, to let out into light those bound in the dark;

2.verse: to proclaim the year of the favor of ADONAI and the day of vengeance of our God; to comfort all who mourn,

3.verse: yes, provide for those in Tziyon who mourn, giving them garlands instead of ashes, the oil of gladness instead of mourning, a cloak of praise instead of a heavy spirit, so that they will be called oaks of righteousness planted by ADONAI, in which he takes pride.

4.verse: They will rebuild the ancient ruins, restore sites long destroyed; they will renew the ruined cities, destroyed many generations ago.

5.verse: Strangers will stand and feed your flocks, foreigners plow your land and tend your vines;

6.verse: but you will be called cohanim of ADONAI, spoken of as ministers to our God. You will feed on the wealth of nations, and revel in their riches.

7.verse: Because of your shame, which was doubled, and because they cried, “They deserve disgrace,” therefore in their land what they own will be doubled, and joy forever will be theirs.

8.verse: “For I, ADONAI, love justice; I hate robbery for burnt offerings. So I will be faithful to reward them and make an eternal covenant with them.”

9.verse: Their descendants will be known among the nations, their offspring among the peoples; all who see them will acknowledge that they are the seed ADONAI has blessed.

10.verse: I am so joyful in ADONAI! My soul rejoices in my God, for he has clothed me in salvation, dressed me with a robe of triumph, like a bridegroom wearing a festive turban, like a bride adorned with her jewels.

11.verse: For just as the earth brings forth its plants, or a garden makes its plants spring up, so ADONAI, God, will cause victory and glory to spring up before all nations.

1.verse: For Tziyon’s sake I will not be silent, for Yerushalayim’s sake I will not rest, until her vindication shines out brightly and her salvation like a blazing torch.

2.verse: The nations will see your vindication and all kings your glory. Then you will be called by a new name which ADONAI himself will pronounce.

3.verse: You will be a glorious crown in the hand of ADONAI, a royal diadem held by your God.

4.verse: You will no longer be spoken of as ‘Azuvah [Abandoned] or your land be spoken of as ‘Sh’mamah [Desolate]; rather, you will be called Heftzi-Vah [My-Delight-Is-In-Her] and your land Be‘ulah [Married]. For ADONAI delights in you, and your land will be married —

5.verse: as a young man marries a young woman, your sons will marry you; as a bridegroom rejoices over the bride, your God will rejoice over you.

6.verse: I have posted watchmen on your walls, Yerushalayim; they will never fall silent, neither by day nor by night. You who call on ADONAI, give yourselves no rest;

7.verse: and give him no rest till he restores Yerushalayim and makes it a praise on earth.

8.verse: ADONAI has sworn by his right hand and by his mighty arm: “Never again will I give your grain to your enemies as food; nor will strangers drink your wine, for which you worked so hard;

9.verse: but those who harvest the grain will eat it with praises to ADONAI; those who gathered the wine will drink it in the courtyards of my sanctuary.”

10.verse: Go on through, go on through the gates, clear the way for the people! Build up a highway, build it up! Clear away the stones! Raise a banner for the peoples!

11.verse: ADONAI has proclaimed to the end of the earth, “Say to the daughter of Tziyon, ‘Here, your Salvation is coming! Here, his reward is with him, and his recompense is before him.’”

12.verse: They will call them The Holy People, The Redeemed of ADONAI. You will be called D’rushah [Sought-After], ‘Ir Lo Ne‘ezvah [City-No-Longer-Abandoned].

1.verse: Who is this, coming from Edom, from Botzrah with clothing stained crimson, so magnificently dressed, so stately in his great strength? “It is I, who speak victoriously, I, well able to save.”

2.verse: Why is your apparel red, your clothes like someone treading a winepress?

3.verse: “I have trodden the winepress alone; from the peoples, not one was with me. So I trod them in my anger, trampled them in my fury; so their lifeblood spurted out on my clothing, and I have stained all my garments;

4.verse: for the day of vengeance that was in my heart and my year of redemption have come.

5.verse: I looked, but there was no one to help, and I was appalled that no one upheld me. Therefore my own arm brought me salvation, and my own fury upheld me.

6.verse: In my anger I trod down the peoples, made them drunk with my fury, then poured out their lifeblood on the earth.”

7.verse: I will recall the grace of ADONAI and the praises of ADONAI, because of all that ADONAI has granted us and his great goodness toward the house of Isra’el, which he bestowed on them in keeping with his mercy, in keeping with the greatness of his grace.

8.verse: For he said, “They are indeed my people, children who are not disloyal.” So he became their Savior.

9.verse: In all their troubles he was troubled; then the Angel of His Presence saved them; in his love and pity he redeemed them. He had lifted them up and carried them throughout the days of old.

10.verse: However, they rebelled, they grieved his Holy Spirit; so he became their enemy and himself fought against them.

11.verse: But then his people remembered the days of old, the days of Moshe: “Where is he who brought them up from the sea with the shepherds of his flock? Where is he who put his Holy Spirit right there among them,

12.verse: who caused his glorious arm to go at Moshe’s right hand? He divided the water ahead of them, to make himself an eternal name;

13.verse: he led them through the deep like a sure-footed horse through the desert;

14.verse: like cattle going down into a valley the Spirit of ADONAI had them rest. This is how you led your people, to make yourself a glorious name.”

15.verse: Look down from heaven; and see from your holy, glorious dwelling. Where are your zeal and your mighty deeds, your inner concern and compassion? Don’t hold back,

16.verse: for you are our father. Even if Avraham were not to know us, and Isra’el were not to acknowledge us, you, ADONAI, are our father, Our Redeemer of Old is your name.

17.verse: ADONAI, why do you let us wander from your ways and harden our hearts, so that we do not fear you? Return, for the sake of your servants, the tribes who are your possession.

18.verse: Your holy people held your sanctuary such a short time, before our adversaries trampled it down.

19.verse: For so long we have been like those you never ruled, like those who were not called by your name! We wish you would tear open heaven and come down, so the mountains would shake at your presence!

1.verse: It would be like fire kindling the brush, and the fire then makes the water boil. Then your enemies would know your name, the nations would tremble before you!

2.verse: When you did tremendous things that we were not expecting, we wished that you would come down, so that the mountains would shake at your presence!

3.verse: No one has ever heard, no ear perceived, no eye seen, any God but you. You work for him who waits for you.

4.verse: You favored those who were glad to do justice, those who remembered you in your ways. When you were angry, we kept sinning; but if we keep your ancient ways, we will be saved.

5.verse: All of us are like someone unclean, all our righteous deeds like menstrual rags; we wither, all of us, like leaves; and our misdeeds blow us away like the wind.

6.verse: No one calls on your name or bestirs himself to take hold of you, for you have hidden your face from us and caused our misdeeds to destroy us.

7.verse: But now, ADONAI, you are our father; we are the clay, you are our potter; and we are all the work of your hands.

8.verse: Do not be so very angry, ADONAI! Don’t remember crime forever. Look, please, we are all your people.

9.verse: Your holy cities have become a desert, Tziyon a desert, Yerushalayim a ruin.

10.verse: Our holy, beautiful house, where our ancestors used to praise you, has been burned to the ground; all we cherished has been ruined.

11.verse: ADONAI, after all this, will you still hold back? Will you still stay silent and punish us past endurance?

1.verse: “I made myself accessible to those who didn’t ask for me, I let myself be found by those who didn’t seek me. I said, ‘Here I am! Here I am!’ to a nation not called by my name.

2.verse: I spread out my hands all day long to a rebellious people who live in a way that is not good, who follow their own inclinations;

3.verse: a people who provoke me to my face all the time, sacrificing in gardens and burning incense on bricks.

4.verse: They sit among the graves and spend the night in caverns; they eat pig meat and their pots hold soup made from disgusting things.

5.verse: They say, ‘Keep your distance, don’t come near me, because I am holier than you.’ These are smoke in my nose, a fire that burns all day!

6.verse: See, it is written before me; I will not be silent until I repay them; I will repay them to the full,

7.verse: your own crimes and those of your ancestors together,” says ADONAI. “They offered incense on the mountains and insulted me on the hills. First I will measure out their wages and then repay them in full.”

8.verse: Here is what ADONAI says: “As when juice is found in a cluster of grapes, and people say, ‘Don’t destroy it, there is still some good in it,’ so I will do likewise for the sake of my servants, and not destroy them all.

9.verse: I will bring forth descendants from Ya‘akov, heirs of my mountains from Y’hudah; my chosen ones will possess them, and my servants will live there.

10.verse: The Sharon will be a pasture for flocks, the Akhor Valley a place for cattle to rest, for my people who have sought me.

11.verse: “But as for you who abandon ADONAI, who forget my holy mountain, who prepare a table for a Gad, a god of luck, and fill bowls of mixed wine for Meni, a god of destiny —

12.verse: I will destine you to the sword, you will all bow down to be slaughtered; because when I called, you did not answer; when I spoke, you did not hear, but did what was evil from my point of view and chose what did not please me.”

13.verse: Therefore this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: “My servants will eat, while you go hungry; my servants will drink, while you go thirsty. My servants will rejoice, while you will be ashamed.

14.verse: Yes, my servants will sing for joy from their hearts, but you will cry out from the pain in your heart and howl from an anguished spirit.

15.verse: My chosen will use your name as a curse — ‘May Adonai ELOHIM strike you dead!’ But to his servants he will give another name.

16.verse: Thus someone on earth who blesses himself will bless himself by the God of truth, and someone on earth who swears an oath will swear by the God of truth; for past troubles will be forgotten, hidden from my eyes.

17.verse: “For, look! I create new heavens and a new earth; past things will not be remembered, they will no more come to mind.

18.verse: So be glad and rejoice forever in what I am creating; for look! I am making Yerushalayim a joy, and her people a delight.

19.verse: I will rejoice in Yerushalayim and take joy in my people. The sound of weeping will no longer be heard in it, no longer the sound of crying.

20.verse: No more will babies die in infancy, no more will an old man die short of his days — he who dies at a hundred will be thought young, and at less than a hundred thought cursed.

21.verse: They will build houses and live in them, they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

22.verse: They will not build and others live there, they will not plant and others eat; for the days of my people will be like the days of a tree, and my chosen will themselves enjoy the use of what they make.

23.verse: They will not toil in vain or raise children to be destroyed, for they are the seed blessed by ADONAI; and their offspring with them.

24.verse: Before they call, I will answer; while they are still speaking, I will hear.

25.verse: The wolf and the lamb will feed together, and the lion eat straw like an ox (but the serpent — its food will be dust). They will not hurt or destroy anywhere on my holy mountain,” says ADONAI.

1.verse: “Heaven is my throne,” says ADONAI, “and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house could you build for me? What sort of place could you devise for my rest?

2.verse: Didn’t I myself make all these things? This is how they all came to be,” says ADONAI. “The kind of person on whom I look with favor is one with a poor and humble spirit, who trembles at my word.

3.verse: Those others might as well kill a person as an ox, as well break a dog’s neck as sacrifice a lamb, as well offer pig’s blood as offer a grain offering, as well bless an idol as burn incense. Just as these have chosen their ways and enjoy their disgusting practices,

4.verse: so I will enjoy making fools of them, and bring on them the very things they fear. For when I called, no one answered; when I spoke, they did not hear. Instead they did what was evil in my sight and chose what did not please me.”

5.verse: Hear the word of ADONAI, you who tremble at his word: “Your brothers, who hate you and reject you because of my name, have said: ‘Let ADONAI be glorified, so we can see your joy.’ But they will be put to shame.”

6.verse: That uproar in the city, that sound from the temple, is the sound of ADONAI repaying his foes what they deserve.

7.verse: Before going into labor, she gave birth; before her pains came, she delivered a male child.

8.verse: Who ever heard of such a thing? Who has ever seen such things? Is a country born in one day? Is a nation brought forth all at once? For as soon as Tziyon went into labor, she brought forth her children.

9.verse: “Would I let the baby break through and not be born?” asks ADONAI. “Would I, who cause the birth, shut the womb?” asks your God.

10.verse: Rejoice with Yerushalayim! Be glad with her, all you who love her! Rejoice, rejoice with her, all of you who mourned for her;

11.verse: so that you nurse and are satisfied by her comforting breast, drinking deeply and delighting in the overflow of her glory.

12.verse: For ADONAI says, “I will spread shalom over her like a river, and the wealth of nations like a flooding stream; you will nurse and be carried in her arm and cuddled in her lap.

13.verse: Like someone comforted by his mother, I will comfort you; in Yerushalayim you will be comforted.”

14.verse: Your heart will rejoice at the sight, your bodies will flourish like newly sprouted grass. It will be known that the hand of ADONAI is with his servants; but with his enemies, his fury.

15.verse: For — look! — ADONAI will come in fire, and his chariots will be like the whirlwind, to render his anger furiously, his rebuke with blazing fire.

16.verse: For ADONAI will judge all humanity with fire and with the sword, and those slain by ADONAI will be many.

17.verse: “Those who consecrate and purify themselves in order to enter the gardens, then follow the one who was already there, eating pig meat, reptiles and mice, will all be destroyed together,” says ADONAI.

18.verse: “For I [know] their deeds and their thoughts. “[The time] is coming when I will gather together all nations and languages. They will come and see my glory,

19.verse: and I will give them a sign. I will send some of their survivors to the nations of Tarshish, Pul, Lud (these are archers), Tuval, Greece and more distant coasts, where they have neither heard of my fame nor seen my glory. They will proclaim my glory in these nations;

20.verse: and they will bring all your kinsmen out of all the nations as an offering to ADONAI — on horses, in chariots, in wagons, on mules, on camels — to my holy mountain Yerushalayim,” says ADONAI, “just as the people of Isra’el themselves bring their offerings in clean vessels to the house of ADONAI.

21.verse: I will also take cohanim and L’vi’im from them,” says ADONAI.

22.verse: “For just as the new heavens and the new earth that I am making will continue in my presence,” says ADONAI, “so will your descendants and your name continue.

23.verse: “Every month on Rosh-Hodesh and every week on Shabbat, everyone living will come to worship in my presence,” says ADONAI.

24.verse: “As they leave, they will look on the corpses of the people who rebelled against me. For their worm will never die, and their fire will never be quenched; but they will be abhorrent to all humanity.” [“Every month on Rosh-Hodesh and every week on Shabbat, everyone living will come to worship in my presence,” says ADONAI.]
